name: Cubular
tagline: 3D multi-axis comparison charts in a rotatable wireframe cube
description:
Compare anything across three dimensions — and actually see the shape.

Cubular lets you plot entities in a rotatable 3D wireframe cube across any three axes you define. Hover an entity to see its exact values. Rotate the cube to find clusters and outliers you'd never spot in a flat chart. Three 2D projection panels on the side let you read exact positions without losing the 3D context.

The store is generic — any three-dimensional comparison works. Ships with JRPG strategy games plotted across Tactics, Story Depth, and Time Investment as sample data.

changes.text: 3D wireframe cube — rotatable via OrbitControls, perspective camera for depth
Entity points — coloured sphere meshes plotted at (x, y, z) positions 0–1; hover scales and glows with tooltip
Axis name labels — rotate in screen space to always align with their edge regardless of cube rotation
Polar end arrows — directional 3D cone meshes on axis edges; hover reveals min/max label
Sidebar entity stats — each entity lists all three axis values with full label names
Face projections panel — three 80×80 SVG scatter plots (X·Y, X·Z, Y·Z) for 2D cross-sections
Sidebar collapse toggle — collapses to give the cube full screen width
Zustand store — chartStore holds title, axes, and entities; sample data: JRPG strategy games
Removed abbreviated axis stat display in favour of full axis label names
Removed AXES panel from sidebar — redundant with cube labels
Axis labels now track projected 3D edge direction in real time via useFrame
Z axis label was misaligned with depth edge at non-default rotations
Arrow cones now both point toward the max end of their axis
